definitions: the action of scrambling up or over rough or steep ground, especially as a leisure activity

examples.text: the final push for the summit involved some exhilarating scrambling

shortDefinitions: action of scrambling up or over rough or steep ground

definitions: the sport of racing motorcycles over rough and hilly ground

examples.text: he started racing in motorcycle scrambling at the age of ten

shortDefinitions: sport of racing motorcycles over rough and hilly ground

definitions: the alteration of the speech frequency of a telephone conversation or broadcast transmission so as to make it unintelligible without a decoding device

examples.text: he activated the aircraft's radar scrambling unit

shortDefinitions: alteration of speech frequency of telephone conversation or broadcast transmission so as to make it unintelligible without decoding device
